member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileSize
member.summary: Constants which define the size and shape of a live tile frame.

remarks.p: The actual size for tiles displayed at the 'Small' size can be changed via the TileSizeSmall property. Changing this value affects the size of all tiles, as the actual size for all tiles is based on the small size, along with the TileSpacing.
The following table lists the default sizes for the 'Small' setting at each resolution scale:

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileSize.Small
member.summary: A small tile with the same width and height. The width and height are determined by the value of the TileSizeSmall property.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileSize.Medium
member.summary: A square tile which occupies the same amount of space as a 2 x 2 grid of small tiles. For example, with a 'Small'size of 70 pixels, and 10 pixels of tile spacing, the dimensions of a medium tile is (70 + 10) X 2 = 150 x 150.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileSize.Wide
member.summary: A tile with a width that is equal to two medium tiles plus spacing, and the same height as a medium tile. For example, with a 'Medium'size of 150 pixels, and 10 pixels of tile spacing, the dimensions of a wide tile is (150 X 2) + 10 = 310 X 150.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileSize.Large
member.summary: A large square tile with a width and height that are both equal to two medium tiles plus spacing. For example, with a 'Medium'size of 150 pixels, and 10 pixels of tile spacing, the dimensions of a large square tile is (150 + 10) X 2 = 310 X 310.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileFrameAnimation
member.summary: Constants which define the animation style for a live tile frame.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileFrameAnimation.SlideFromBottom
member.summary: (Default) The tile frame appears by gradually sliding from the bottom edge of the tile toward the top.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileFrameAnimation.None
member.summary: No animation. Tile frames

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileFrameAnimation.SlideFromTop
member.summary: The tile frame appears by gradually sliding from the top edge of the tile toward the bottom.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileFrameAnimation.SlideFromLeft
member.summary: The tile frame appears by gradually sliding from the left edge of the tile toward the right.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileFrameAnimation.SlideFromRight
member.summary: The tile frame appears by gradually sliding from the right edge of the tile toward the left.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileFrameAnimation.Fade
member.summary: The new tile frame appears by fading in while the previous frame fades out.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileTemplateTextSize
member.summary: Constants which define the sizes available to the textual elements of a live tile.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileTemplateTextSize.Small
member.summary: The smallest text size; typically used to display a logo's short name.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileTemplateTextSize.Normal
member.summary: Scale100Percent text size; typically used to display the lines of text within a live tile.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileTemplateTextSize.Heading
member.summary: Large text size; typically used to display a header within a live tile.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileTemplateTextSize.Block
member.summary: The largest text size; typically used to display a short string as a large block of text for the TileMediumBlock, TileWideBlockAndText01, and TileWideBlockAndText02 tile templates.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.ResolutionScale
member.summary: Constants which define relative screen resolutions.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.ResolutionScale.Scale80Percent
member.summary: Specifies the scale of display as 80%. This percentage indicates that the screen resolution is less than 1366 X 768.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.ResolutionScale.Scale100Percent
member.summary: Specifies the scale of display as 100%. This percentage indicates that the screen resolution is equal to or greater than 1366 X 768, and less than 1920 X 1080.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.ResolutionScale.Scale140Percent
member.summary: Specifies the scale of display as 140%. This percentage indicates that the screen resolution is equal to or greater than 1920 X 1080, and less than 2560 X 1440.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.ResolutionScale.Scale180Percent
member.summary: Specifies the scale of display as 140%. This percentage indicates that the screen resolution is equal to or greater than 2560 X 1440.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.ImageScaling
member.summary: Bitflags which define the manner in which the size and/or placement of an image is adjusted when the size of the image is different than that of the area in which it is being displayed.

remarks.p: Note that with all settings, the original aspect ratio of the image is always maintained.

For images which are smaller than the image display area, the image can either be displayed at its natural size, leaving part of the image display area uncovered, or expanded so that it fills the image display area completely.

For images which are larger than the image display area, two scaling modes are supported. When the 'ScaleToFit' flag is set without the 'FillWhenLarger' flag, the image is resized so that its larger dimension fits exactly within the image display area. This setting ensures that the entire image is visible, but can cause part of the image display area to remain uncovered.

When the 'FillWhenLarger' flag is set, the image is resized so that one dimension fits exactly within the image display area. The other dimension is then resized according to the original aspect ratio of the image, and the image is then centered within the image display area, clipping the top/bottom or left/right edges of the image, depending on the dimensions of the image display area.
The scaling mode can be specified for individual images, image sets, all images displayed for a given tile, or for all tiles, depending on the object on which the property is set.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.ImageScaling.None
member.summary: No scaling; the image is displayed at its natural size. If the area in which the image is displayed is not large enough to accommodate the image, the right and bottom edges of the image are clipped.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.ImageScaling.ScaleToFit
member.summary: Images with a natural size that is greater than that of the area in which they are displayed are scaled so as to fit within that area. Aspect ratio is maintained. When combined with the 'FillWhenLarger' setting, the image is scaled in such a way as to fill the image area, clipping the larger of the two dimensions, and centering within the image area. Note that this setting has no effect on images whose natural size is smaller than that of the image display area.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.ImageScaling.FillWhenSmaller
member.summary: In cases where the natural size of the image is smaller than that of the area in which it is displayed, the image size is expanded such that one dimension fits exactly. Since aspect ratio is maintained, this may cause the other dimension to exceed that of the display area; in this case, the image is clipped and centered. Clear this flag to avoid scaling of images that are smaller than the image display area.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.ImageScaling.FillWhenLarger
member.summary: The image width or height is contracted so as to fit within the image display area. Since aspect ratio is maintained, this may cause the other dimension to remain larger that of the display area; in this case, the image is clipped and centered. Clear this flag to fit the image within the display area, while still allowing the area to remain partially unfilled.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.ImageScaling.Fill
member.summary: Combines the 'FillWhenSmaller' and 'FillWhenLarger' settings.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileStates
member.summary: Constants which identify the user interface states supported by tiles.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileStates.Normal
member.summary: Normal state, i.e., not active, hot tracking, selected, etc.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileStates.Active
member.summary: The tile is in the active state, i.e., has the keyboard focus.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileStates.Selected
member.summary: The tile is in the selected state, i.e., is present in the control's SelectedTiles collection.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileStates.HotTracking
member.summary: The tile is in the hot tracking state, i.e., the cursor is currently positioned over it.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.GroupStates
member.summary: Constants which identify the user interface states supported by groups.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.GroupStates.Normal
member.summary: Normal state, i.e., not active, hot tracking, selected, etc.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.GroupStates.Active
member.summary: The group is in the active state, i.e., has the keyboard focus.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.GroupStates.HotTracking

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateMedium.TileMediumBlock
member.summary: One short string of large block text over a single, short line of bold, regular text.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateMedium.TileMediumText01
F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateMedium.TileMediumText02
member.summary: One header string in larger text on the first line, over one string of regular text wrapped over a maximum of three lines.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateMedium.TileMediumText03
member.summary: Four strings of regular text on four lines. Text does not wrap.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateMedium.TileMediumText04
member.summary: One string of regular text wrapped over a maximum of four lines.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateMedium.TileMediumImage
member.summary: One square image that fills the entire tile, no text.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateWide.TileWideText01
member.summary: One header string in larger text on the first line, four strings of regular text on the next four lines. Text does not wrap.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateWide.TileWideText02
member.summary: One header string in larger text over eight short strings arranged in two columns of four lines each. Columns are of equal width.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateWide.TileWideText03
member.summary: One string of large text wrapped over a maximum of three lines.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateWide.TileWideText04
member.summary: One string of regular text wrapped over a maximum of five lines.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateWide.TileWideText05
member.summary: Five strings of regular text on five lines. Text does not wrap.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateWide.TileWideText06
member.summary: Ten short strings of regular text, arranged in two columns of five lines each. Columns are of equal width.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateWide.TileWideText07
member.summary: One header string in larger text over eight short strings of regular text arranged in two columns of four lines each. The column widths are such that the first column acts as a label and the second column as the content. This template is similar to TileWideText10, but the first column is wider.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateWide.TileWideText08
member.summary: Ten short strings of regular text arranged in two columns of five lines each. The column widths are such that the first column acts as a label and the second column as the content. This template is similar to TileWideText11, but the first column is wider.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateWide.TileWideText09
member.summary: One header string in larger text over one string of regular text wrapped over a maximum of four lines.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateWide.TileWideText10
member.summary: One header string in larger text over eight short strings of regular text arranged in two columns of four lines each. The column widths are such that the first column acts as a label and the second column as the content. This template is similar to TileWideText07, but the first column is narrower.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateWide.TileWideText11
member.summary: Ten short strings of regular text arranged in two columns of five lines each. The column widths are such that the first column acts as a label and the second column as the content. This template is similar to TileWideText08, but the first column is narrower.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateWide.TileWideImage
member.summary: One wide image that fills the entire tile, no text.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateWide.TileWideImageCollection
member.summary: One large square image with four smaller square images to its right, no text.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateWide.TileWideImageAndText01
member.summary: One wide image over one string of regular text wrapped over a maximum of two lines. Note: This template allows branding only as 'Logo' or 'None', but not 'Name'. If branding is set to 'Name', it will automatically revert to 'Logo'.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateWide.TileWideImageAndText02
member.summary: One wide image over two strings of regular text on two lines. Text does not wrap. Note: This template allows branding only as 'Logo' or 'None', but not 'Name'. If branding is set to 'Name', it will automatically revert to 'Logo'.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateWide.TileWideBlockAndText01
member.summary: Four strings of regular, unwrapped text on the left; large block text over a single, short string of bold, regular text on the right.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateWide.TileWideBlockAndText02
member.summary: One string of regular text wrapped over a maximum of four lines on the left; large block text over a single, short string of bold, regular text on the right.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateWide.TileWideSmallImageAndText01
member.summary: On the left, one small image; on the right, one string of large text wrapped over a maximum of three lines.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateWide.TileWideSmallImageAndText02
member.summary: On the left, one small image; on the right, one header string in larger text on the first line over four strings of regular text on the next four lines. Text does not wrap.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateWide.TileWideSmallImageAndText03
member.summary: On the left, one small image; on the right, one string of regular text wrapped over a maximum of five lines.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateWide.TileWideSmallImageAndText04
member.summary: On the left, one small image; on the right, one header string of larger text on the first line over one string of regular text wrapped over a maximum of four lines.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.Internal.TileTemplateWide.TileWideSmallImageAndText05
member.summary: On the left, one header string in larger text over one string of regular text wrapped over a maximum of four lines; on the right, one small image with a 3:4 aspect ratio.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.ApplicationBar
member.summary: Returns an object which exposes properties related to the application bar.

remarks.p: The application bar provides access to commands in a similar fashion as a context menu. It appears alongside the bottom edge of the control when a tile is selected, providing the user with access to context-sensitive commands.

members.member:
Returns or sets the currently active group.
The ActiveGroup property cannot be set directly when the control is expanded; attempting to do so causes an exception to be thrown.
A group is activated when the user navigates to it via keyboard.
When the control is expanded, this property returns null.
Expanded. ActiveTile.

Returns or sets the currently active tile.
The ActiveTile property can only be set directly when the control is expanded. Attempting to set this property when the control is collapsed causes an exception to be thrown.
When the control is collapsed, this property returns null.
The active tile is the tile with the keyboard focus. Tiles can be selected using the SelectedTiles collection.
A tile is activated when the user navigates to it via the keyboard.
This property returns null when the ApplicationBar has the input focus.
Expanded. ActiveGroup.

Returns a collection which contains the tiles that are currently selected.
Tiles can be selected via the mouse by right-clicking, and via the keyboard by pressing the spacebar. On gesture-enabled devices, tiles can also be selected by a short vertical pan gesture.
When a tile is selected, it displays a checkbox in its upper-right corner. Multiple tiles can be selected; note that it is not necessary to press the Control key to extend a tile selection. Range selection is not supported.
Note that the SelectedTiles collection is cleared when the value of the Expanded property is changed.
TileSelection. ActiveTile.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.Expanded
member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating whether the control is currently expanded.

remarks.p: When the control is in the expanded state, groups and items are displayed at their normal size. Items respond to user interaction, and can be activated or selected.

When the control is in the collapsed state, groups and items are displayed at a smaller size. Groups respond to user interaction, and can be activated or selected. When in this state, items are not UI active.
Tiles display their CollapsedImage when the Expanded property is set to false. If no collapsed image is defined, the tile's logo is displayed (for live tiles), or its image (for static tiles).

The control can be expanded/collapsed via a button which appears at the bottom right corner of the control. This button's visibility can be controlled via the ExpandButtonVisibility and CollapseButtonVisibility properties. On gesture-enabled devices, the expanded state can be changed via "zoom" and "pinch" gestures.
Note that changing the value of this property causes the SelectedTiles collection to be cleared.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.Groups
member.summary: Returns a collection which contains the groups displayed by the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.Metrics
member.summary: Returns an object which exposes metrics-related properties for the control, keyed by resolution scale.

remarks.p: Because screen resolutions can vary considerably among users of an application, user interface element sizes that are appropriate at one screen resolution may be inappropriate at significantly lower or higher resolutions.
The object returned from this property exposes properties which control values such as tile size and spacing, group spacing, font sizes, etc.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.PreferredMaxTileRows
member.summary: Returns or sets the preferred maximum number of rows in which tiles are displayed.

remarks.p: Tiles are arranged from top to bottom, and then from left to right. The PreferredMaxTileRows property determines the number of logical tile rows that appear in a column before wrapping to a new column.
The height of a logical tile row is determined by the value of the TileSizeSmall property. Medium and Wide tiles occupy two logical rows, and Large tiles occupy four tile rows.
The control always displays a minimum of four tile rows (a large tile occupies four rows), so that all tile sizes can be accommodated.
Assigning a value of zero to this property results in the control displaying as many tile rows as is possible based on the current height of the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.TileRows
member.summary: Returns the actual number of tile rows that are displayed, based on the current size of the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.EventManager
member.summary: Returns the event manager for the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.CurrentState
member.summary: Returns a value which describes the current state of the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.KeyActionMappings
member.summary: Returns an object which facilitates customization of keyboard behavior for the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.TileAppearance
member.summary: Returns an object which exposes an Appearance for each possible tile state.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.GroupAppearance
member.summary: Returns an object which exposes an Appearance for each possible group state.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.ResolutionScale
member.summary: Returns or sets the resolution scale for the control.

remarks.p: Normally, the developer will want the control to observe the actual screen resolution for the local machine, which it does when no value is assigned to this property.

In cases where it is convenient to force the control to only recognize one relative screen resolution, this property can be set accordingly. All metrics calculations will proceed as if the actual screen resolution is that which corresponds to the value of this property.
By default, this property uses the PrimaryMonitorSize property of the SystemInformation class to determine the screen resolution, and returns that value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.HighContrast
member.summary: Returns or sets the high-contrast setting for the control.

remarks.p: Normally, the developer will want the control to observe the actual high-contrast setting for the local machine, which it does when no value is assigned to this property.

In cases where it is convenient to force the control to behave as if high-contrast mode is enabled/disabled, this property can be set accordingly. In this case, image resolution will proceed as if the actual high-contrast setting is that which corresponds to the value of this property.
By default, this property uses the HighContrast property of the SystemInformation class to determine whether high-contrast mode is enabled, and returns that value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.ImageTransparentColor
member.summary: Returns or sets the transparent color for images with no more specific setting.

remarks.p: Use this property to mask out pixels of a given value; pixels whose color match the value of this property are not rendered;
Note that the transparent color can be assigned for a specific image using the TransparentColor property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.ImageScaling
member.summary: Returns or sets a flagged value which determines the manner in which size and/or placement of images is adjusted when the image size is different than that of the area in which it is displayed.

remarks.p: Note that the original aspect ratio of the image is always maintained.
Note that the scaling can be changed for a specific image using the Scaling property.

By default, images whose natural size is smaller than that of the image display area are not resized to fit in the image display area, whereas images whose natural size is larger are resized. In other words, images are shrunk when necessary, but not expanded.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.UIElement
member.summary: Returns a reference to the UltraLiveTileViewUIElement instance which represents this control in the user interface.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.ScrollBarLook
member.summary: Determines the appearance of the control's scrollbar

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.TileSelection
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the manner in which tiles can be selected.

remarks.p: Tile selection is not supported when the Expanded property returns false; in this mode, only groups can be selected.

The TileSelection property enables the developer to prevent tile selection, limit it to only one tile at a time, or tiles within the same groups, and also to allow tiles in different groups to be concurrently selected.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.CultureName
member.summary: Returns or sets the name of the current culture associated with the control.

remarks.p: When this property is not explicitly, it returns the value of the local machine's System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture property.
This property can be set to any valid culture name to make the control behave exactly as it does when that culture is returned from the CultureInfo's CurrentCulture property.

In cases where different tile views are defined for different cultures (via the DefaultView property of the LiveTile class), this property is checked before the tile decides which view is currently applicable. If this property is set, the associated culture is used, otherwise, the local machine's current culture is used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.Culture
member.summary: Returns the culture specified by the CultureName property, or if none is specified, the local machine's System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture.

remarks.p: The culture returned from this property determines which view is displayed for a tile.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.ExpandButtonVisibility
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines whether a button is displayed at the lower right corner of the control which allows the user to set the control's Expanded property to true.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.CollapseButtonVisibility
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines whether a button is displayed at the lower right corner of the control which allows the user to set the control's Expanded property to false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.DpiAware
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether font sizes are automatically adjusted to compensate for the local machine's DPI adjustments.

remarks.p: The UltraLiveTileView control extends a mechanism through which the size of fonts can be controlled by the developer. Adjusting the DPI setting for the local machine can result in enlargement of these fonts, causing the tile content layouts to change unexpectedly.

The DpiAware property determines whether the control will adjust font sizes to compensate for this enlargement. When DpiAware is set to true, all font sizes are adjusted by a scaling factor which is determined by the ratio of the local machine's DPI to the "normal" DPI setting of 96. This scaling factor is applied to all font sizes before content is displayed, ensuring that the content layouts remain unaffected by the local machine's DPI settings.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.AnimationEnabled
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether frame transitions and user interactions with tiles are animated.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.IsCustomizing
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating whether the control is currently in customize mode.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.SelectionCheckmarkColor
member.summary: Returns or sets the color of the checkmark for selected tiles or groups.

remarks.p: Use this property to change the color of the checkmark that appears when a tile or group is selected. If no color is selected (default), then the LiveTileView will calculate an appropriate contrasting color based on the background color.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.TileSizing
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the value or values to which the CurrentSize property of a tile can be changed via the user interface.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileView.LeftClickInCustomizeModeBehavior
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines what happens when the user left-clicks on a tile while in customize mode.
member.remarks: When the user right-clicks on a tile, the tile is selected, the application bar is shown, and the UltraLiveTileView enters customization mode. In this mode, left-clicking on a tile will select or deselect tiles by default, just as in the Windows 8.1 start screen. Setting this property to LeftClickLaunches which cause the left click to close the application bar, clear the selection, and fire the TileClick event, which is how the start screen works in Windows 8.0.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileBase.CurrentSize
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the current size and dimensions of the tile.

remarks.p: Static tiles support the 'Small' and 'Medium' sizes; Live tiles support 'Small', 'Medium', 'Wide', and 'Large' sizes.
Setting the CurrentSize property on a StaticTile to 'Wide' or 'Large' is not supported, and causes an exception to be thrown.
Use the Sizing property to control how the user can change this property via the user interface.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileBase.CurrentSizeResolved
member.summary: Returns the resolved value of the CurrentSize property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileBase.Key
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which uniquely identifies this tile within the group to which it belongs, or an empty string if no key was specified for this tile.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileBase.Appearance
member.summary: Returns an object which exposes an Appearance for each possible tile state.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileBase.Group
member.summary: Returns the group to which this tile belongs.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileBase.Control
member.summary: Returns a reference to the associated UltraLiveTileView control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileBase.ToolTipText
member.summary: Returns or sets the string that is displayed in a tooltip when the user hovers the mouse over this tile.

remarks.p: Tooltips are displayed for all tile sizes when the ToolTipText property is explicitly set.
Tooltips are automatically displayed when the tile's CurrentSize property is set to 'Small'.
Static tiles automatically display a tooltip when the text cannot be fully displayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileBase.DefaultToolTipText
member.summary: Returns the string displayed in the tile's tooltip when no tooltip text is specified.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileBase.State
member.summary: Returns a value which identifies the current state of this tile.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileBase.CollapsedImage
member.summary: Returns an object which defines the image that is displayed when the associated control is in the collapsed state.

remarks.p: This property is only applicable when the control's Expanded property is set to false.

When the control is collapsed, tiles are rendered at a considerably smaller size than when it is expanded. An image that is appropriately sized for the expanded state might not appear correctly at this smaller size; this property provides a way for the developer to specify a different image to be displayed when the tile is drawn at this smaller size.

Note: Collapsed tiles are rendered at the same size for all screen resolutions, which is equal to one-fifth the value of the TileSizeSmall property for the 'Scale100Percent' screen resolution setting.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileBase.SmallImage
member.summary: Returns the image set which contains the images available for display when the tile's CurrentSize property is set to 'Small'.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileBase.LayoutDimensions
member.summary: Returns a Size struct containing the column and row spans. Width is column span, Height is row span.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileBase.Index
member.summary: Returns the ordinal position of this tile within the tiles collection to which it belongs.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileBase.IsInView
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating whether any part of this tile is currently within the viewable area of the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileBase.HasWideFrames
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating whether this tile can display a wide frame.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileBase.HasLargeFrames
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating whether this tile can display a large frame.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileBase.Sizing
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the value or values to which the CurrentSize property can be changed via the user interface.

remarks.p: The Sizing property can be used to prevent the user from changing the CurrentSize property to values that the developer opts not to support.

member.summary: Sends a badge notification to this tile.
member.param: The numeric value to be displayed on the badge.
The maximum numeric value. If the value of the numericValue parameter exceeds this value, the maximum numeric value is displayed with a '+' appended to it.

remarks.p: This method cannot be called on a tile that is not associated with a control; attempting to do so will cause an exception to be thrown.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTile.DefaultToolTipText
member.summary: Returns the string displayed in the tile's tooltip when no tooltip text is specified.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTile.FrameAnimation
member.summary: Returns or sets the animation style for frames displayed within this tile.

remarks.p: The FrameAnimation property determines which visual effect is applied to a tile frame when it appears. The animation that is applied when one frame disappears is determined by the animation for the frame which is about to be shown.
The animation style can be overridden for a specific frame using the frame's Animation property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTile.FrameInterval
member.summary: Returns or sets the amount of time between tile frame transitions.

remarks.p: The FrameInterval property determines the amount of time a tile frame remains visible before the next one in the associated frames collection is displayed.
The interval can be overridden for a specific frame using the frame's Interval property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTile.FrameChangingEnabled
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether this tile automatically changes frames.

remarks.p: By default, live tile automatically cycles through each frame in the currently active frames collection, provided that at least two frames exist in the collection. Set the FrameChangingEnabled property to false to suspend frame changing for this tile.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTile.Logo
member.summary: Returns an object which encapsulates the properties of the logo which is displayed in the bottom-left corner of the tile.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTile.DefaultView
member.summary: Returns the view which determines the content displayed for this tile when no view exists in the CultureSpecificViews collection for the current culture.

remarks.p: Use the DefaultView property to define a view for the tile that is not specific to a particular culture, or when application internationalization is not a concern.

The CultureSpecificViews collection can be used to define a view for a particular culture. When the local machine's current culture matches an item in the CultureSpecificViews collection, that view defines the content that is displayed for that user.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTile.CultureSpecificViews
member.summary: Returns a collection of LiveTileView derived objects which represent the tile content for a specific culture.

remarks.p: The CultureSpecificViews collection stores live tile views that are targeted at a particular culture.
When the local machine's current culture matches an item in this collection, that item determines the view for the tile.

Use the DefaultView property to define a view that is not targeted at any particular culture. The default view is used when the CultureSpecificViews collection is empty, and also when the current culture does not match any of the items in the CultureSpecificViews collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTile.CurrentView
member.summary: Returns a reference to the view currently in use by this tile.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTile.CurrentSizeResolved
member.summary: Returns the resolved value of the CurrentSize property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTile.HasWideFrames
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating whether this tile can display a wide frame.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTile.HasLargeFrames
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating whether this tile can display a large frame.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTileBadge
member.summary: Encapsulates the badge displayed by a live tile.

remarks.p: A tile badge can display either a status glyph or a numeric value.
To clear a previously displayed badge, set the Glyph property to 'None', and the NumericValue property to zero.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTileBadge.DefaultMaxNumericValue
member.summary: Returns the default value for the maximum numeric value that is displayed on the badge (99).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTileBadge.Glyph
member.summary: Returns or sets the status glyph that is displayed on the badge.

remarks.p: A tile badge can display either a status glyph or a numeric value.
When the Glyph property is set to a value other than 'None', the glyph is displayed on the badge, i.e., this property takes precedence over the NumericValue property.
When the Glyph property is set to 'None', the value of the NumericValue property is displayed, unless NumericValue is set to zero, in which case nothing is displayed and the badge is cleared.
To clear a previously displayed badge, set the Glyph property to 'None', and the NumericValue property to zero.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTileBadge.NumericValue
member.summary: Returns or sets the numeric value that is displayed on the badge.

remarks.p: A tile badge can display either a numeric value or a status glyph.
When the Glyph property is set to a value other than 'None', the glyph is displayed on the badge, i.e., the Glyph property takes precedence over this property.
When the Glyph property is set to 'None', the value of the this property is displayed, unless this property is set to zero, in which case nothing is displayed and the badge is cleared.
To clear a previously displayed badge, set the Glyph property to 'None', and the this property to zero.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTileBadge.MaxNumericValue
member.summary: Returns or sets the maximum value for the NumericValue property; when the NumericValue exceeds this value, the MaxNumericValue is displayed with a '+' appended to it.

remarks.p: This property defaults to a value of 99; when the value of the NumericValue exceeds the value of this property, the value of this property is displayed with a '+' appended to it.

Setting this property to zero removes the display constraint and causes the actual value of the NumericValue property to be displayed. Note, however, that because the amount of space reserved for the badge is fixed, large numeric values may not be fully displayed, which can be misleading to the user. This is also true in the case where MaxNumericValue is set to a large value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTileBadge.IsEmpty
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating whether this badge is empty, i.e., will not be displayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTileBadge.Empty
member.summary: Returns an instance of this class which represents a cleared badge, i.e., one that is not displayed on the associated tile.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileWideText07
member.summary: One header string in larger text over eight short strings of regular text arranged in two columns of four lines each. The column widths are such that the first column acts as a label and the second column as the content. This template is similar to TileWideText10, except that the first column is wider.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileLargeBlockAndText01
member.summary: Two main text groups separated by a blank area: One string of large text, which can wrap over up to two lines, sitting over two strings of unwrapped regular text on two lines. member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileLargeText05
member.summary: One header string in larger text over eighteen short strings of regular text arranged in two columns of nine lines each. The column widths are such that the first column acts as a label and the second column as the content. This template is similar to , but the first column is wider.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileLargeText08
member.summary: Twenty-two short strings of regular text arranged in two columns of eleven lines each. The column widths are such that the first column acts as a label and the second column as the content. This template is similar to , but the first column is narrower.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTileFrame`1.Animation
member.summary: Returns or sets the animation style for this frame.

remarks.p: To make the animation style the same for all frames within a collection, use the FrameAnimation property.
In the absence of an explicit setting, the actual animation style for this frame resolves to the value of the tile's FrameAnimation property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTileFrame`1.Index
member.summary: Returns the ordinal position of this frame within the collection to which it belongs.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTileFrame`1.Interval
member.summary: Returns or sets the amount of time for which this frame is displayed within the associated tile.

remarks.p: To make the interval the same for all frames within a collection, use the FrameInterval property.
In the absence of an explicit setting, the actual interval for this frame resolves to the value of the tile's FrameInterval property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTileContentElementBase.Location
member.summary: Returns or sets the location of this element, expressed in coordinates relative to the top left corner of the tile.

remarks.p: The element's location is relative to the associated tile; for example, a value of (0, 0) coincides with the top left corner of the tile.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTileContentElementBase.Size
member.summary: Returns or sets the size of this element, expressed in pixels.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTileContentElementBase.Bounds
member.summary: Returns or sets the bounds for this element.

remarks.p: Setting this property is the equivalent of setting the Location and Size properties as one atomic operation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTileContentElementBase.ZOrder
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which describes this element's placement along the z-axis.

remarks.p: Elements with a larger value appear in the foreground with respect to elements with smaller values.
To place one element in the background with respect to all others, set this property to a value less than zero, leaving the value for all other elements at zero.
To place one element in the foreground with respect to all others, set this property to a value greater than zero, leaving the value for all other elements at zero.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTileContentElementBase.DefaultSize
member.summary: Retuns the default size of this element.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTileContentTextElement.Text
member.summary: Returns or sets the text to be displayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTileContentTextElement.TextSize
member.summary: Returns or sets the relative size at which the text is displayed.

remarks.p: Note: This property is not applicable when the UseAppearanceFontSize property is set to true. In that case, the size of the text is determined by the size specified on the appearance's FontData.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTileContentTextElement.MaxLines
member.summary: Returns or sets the maximum number of lines of text displayed by this element.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTileContentTextElement.UseAppearanceFontSize
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether the size of the font specified on this object's Appearance is applied to the this element.

remarks.p: This property overrides the TextSize property.

In most cases, a tile's content can be customized sufficiently using one of the four fonts available to the template-based content types. In cases where additional flexibility is required, set the UseAppearanceFontSize property to true, and set the font size on the element's Appearance.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileImage.Image
member.summary: Returns or sets the image to be displayed.

remarks.p: The location of the image data can be specified via the ImageSource property; this can reduce the size of the object graph considerably for larger images.
When this property is explicitly set, it takes precedence over the ImageSource property.
Note that a different image can be provided for high-contrast mode using the HighContrastImage property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileImage.ImageSource
member.summary: Returns or sets a string which identifies the source of the image data.

remarks.p: Use the ImageSource property when the image is unavailable or unknown at the time of application deployment, or to reduce the size of the stream containing the serialized data for the associated tile.
The value of this property can refer to a file path or a URI (uniform resource identifier). When referring to a URI, the UriKind is presumed to be absolute.
Note that a different image source can be provided for high-contrast mode using the HighContrastImageSource property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileImage.Scaling
member.summary: Returns or sets a flagged value which determines the manner in which this image is scaled to fit within the area in which it is displayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.TileImage.TransparentColor
member.summary: Returns or sets the color which is replaced with transparent pixels.

remarks.p: Use this property to mask out pixels of a given value; pixels whose color match the value of this property are not rendered.
Note that a different transparent color can be provided for high-contrast mode using the HighContrastTransparentColor property.

member.summary: Returns an image which is used when no specific value is assigned for a given resolution scale.

remarks.p: In keeping with Windows 8 best practices, a different image can be specified for each of the four relative resolution scales to prevent the distortion caused by scaling. In cases where this is not a concern to the developer, an image can be specified for all resolutions; the size of this image is then scaled, based on the screen resolution of the local machine.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTileLogo
member.summary: Encapsulates the logo displayed by a live tile.

remarks.p: The tile logo, or "branding", is displayed in the lower left corner of the tile.
The tile can display either an Image or the ShortName in the logo area.
When both the Image and ShortName are set, the ShortName property takes precedence; in this case the text is displayed, but not the image.

member.summary: Returns the relative size at which the value of the ShortName property is displayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTileLogo.Image
member.summary: Returns a TileImage object which encapsulates the image to be displayed in the logo area.

remarks.p: The tile can either display an image or the value of the ShortName property in the logo area.
The ShortName takes precedence; when it is set, no image is displayed.

Note that because displaying a logo reduces the amount of space available in which to display tile content, a tile which displays multiple lines of text will display one less line of text than it would otherwise.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTileLogo.ShortName
member.summary: Returns or sets a short string to be displayed in the logo area.

remarks.p: The tile logo can either display a short name or an image. The ShortName takes precedence; when it is set, no image is displayed.

Note that because displaying a logo reduces the amount of space available in which to display tile content, a tile which displays multiple lines of text will display one less line of text than it would otherwise.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTileView.ResetFrames
member.summary: Resets the tile frame display sequences so that the first frame in the collection is the next one to be displayed.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.LiveTileView.ResetFrames(System.Int32)
member.summary: Resets the tile frame display sequences so that the frame at the specified ordinal position in the collection is the next one to be displayed.
member.param: The zero-based ordinal position of the frame that will be the next one to be displayed. This value is relative to the current frames collection, i.e., the MediumFrames collection if the tile's current size is 'Medium', or the WideFrames collection if the tile's current size is 'Wide'.

remarks.p: The frames collection on which this method acts depends on the value of the associated tile's CurrentSize property.

Specifying a value for the parameter that is less than zero results in an exception being thrown. Specifying a value that is greater than or equal to the count of the current frames collection results in the frame counter being set to zero, i.e., the first frame in the current frames collection becomes the next one to be displayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.CultureSpecificLiveTileView.CultureName
member.summary: Returns the name of the culture associated with this instance.

remarks.p: The value of this property can represent either a neutral or specific culture. When the specified culture code references a neutral culture (for example, 'en', 'fr', or 'ja'), the associated view will be used for any specific culture whose Parent property references that neutral culture.

When the specified culture code references a specific culture (for example, 'en-US', 'fr-FR', or 'ja-JP'), the associated view will only be used when the name of the current culture matches the value of this property exactly.
For example, if the CultureName property is set to 'en', the associated view is used when the current culture is 'en-US', 'en-GB', 'en-CA', 'en-AU', etc.

However, if the CultureName property is set to a specific culture name such as 'en-US', 'en-GB', 'en-CA', 'en-AU', etc., the associated view is only used if the name of the current culture matches this property's value exactly.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.CultureSpecificLiveTileView.Culture
member.summary: Returns the culture associated with this instance.

member.summary: CultureSpecificLiveTileView object type converter.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileViewMetrics
member.summary: Exposes metrics related properties for each of the four relative screen resolutions at which a tile may be displayed.

remarks.p: One aspect of the Windows 8 user experience relates to screen resolution. Unlike platforms where the hardware and software are tightly coupled, Windows can be run on a variety of devices and configurations. This implies that different users of the same application can have widely disparate machine configurations.

Consider the case where the same application is run by one user on a desktop with a relatively low-resolution monitor, and another with a high-resolution tablet. A user interface element with a fixed pixel size will appear considerably smaller on the high-resolution monitor when compared to the same element on a low-resolution desktop. In the current technological environment, where touch-enabled devices are more prevalent, this can adversely affect an application's usability.
Live tiles are displayed at different sizes depending on the current resolution of the user's display adapter, as outlined in the following table:
The UltraLiveTileViewMetrics class provides a way for the developer to override the default size of resolution-specific values such as tile size and spacing, font size, etc.

member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating whether the corresponding property requires serialization.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileViewMetrics.AllResolutions
member.summary: Returns an object which determines metric values which are used when no specific value is assigned for a given resolution scale.

remarks.p: The UltraLiveTileViewMetrics class exposes a metrics property for each of the four relative screen resolutions; the values defined by each of these classes is specific to a particular screen resolution.

The object returned from this property exposes the same metrics properties as its resolution-dependent counterparts. Setting one of those metrics properties on this object defines a value that is scaled and used for all screen resolutions.

For example, assume the TileSizeSmall property is set to a value of 120 on this resolution-independent object, and that none of the resolution dependent objects have a value specified for TileSizeSmall. Assume also that the ResolutionScale property is left at its default value of 'Scale100Percent'.

When the control determines the actual size of a tile, it takes this value (120), evaluates it against the value of the ResolutionScale property to determine the scaling ratio, and then uses this scaled value for the resolution dependent object.
Using this example, the setting of 120 results in tile sizes of 150, 120, 86, and 67 for the Scale80Percent, Scale100Percent, Scale140Percent, and Scale180Percent resolutions, respectively.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileViewMetrics.TileSizeSmallCollapsed
member.summary: Returns size at which square tiles are displayed when the control is in the collapsed state.

remarks.p: The size at which tiles are rendered when the control is collapsed is the same for all relative screen resolutions.
The value of this property is derived by dividing the value of the TileSizeSmall property for the 'Scale100Percent' screen resolution by five.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileViewMetrics.TileSizeMediumCollapsed
member.summary: Returns size at which medium tiles are displayed when the control is in the collapsed state.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileViewMetrics.TileSizeWideCollapsed
member.summary: Returns size at which wide tiles are displayed when the control is in the collapsed state.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileViewMetrics.TileSizeLargeCollapsed
member.summary: Returns size at which large tiles are displayed when the control is in the collapsed state.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileViewMetrics.TileSpacingCollapsed
member.summary: Returns a value which determines the amount of space between tiles when the control is in the collapsed state.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileViewMetrics.GroupSpacingCollapsed
member.summary: Returns a value which determines the amount of space between groups when the control is in the collapsed state.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.UltraLiveTileViewMetrics.ImageSizeCollapsed
member.summary: Returns the size of the area in which a tile's CollapsedImage is displayed.

remarks.p: When the control's Expanded property is set to false, tiles are displayed at a size that is equal to 1/5th the size of square tiles, as determined by the TileSizeSmall property at a resolution scale of 100%.
By default, the TileSizeSmall property (at a resolution scale of 100%) is 150 pixels, making collapsed tiles 30 pixels by default.
Additional padding is applied by dividing the collapsed tile size by 5; using the example above, this results in 30 / 5 = 6 pixels of padding, resulting in an actual image size of 24 pixels.

Images which do not fit in this area are scaled accordingly based on the value of the ImageScaling property. An image of this size or smaller is guaranteed to appear at its natural size, unless this behavior is overridden by setting the ImageScaling to a value which contains the 'FillWhenSmaller' flag.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.ResolutionIndependentMetrics
member.summary: Exposes properties related to the sizing of various user interface elements, where the values are not specific to any relative screen resolution.

remarks.p: The UltraLiveTileView control exposes a separate metrics object for each of the four relative screen resolutions, so that property values that control the size of something can be fine-tuned for a specific screen resolution. The property values of those metrics objects are only used when the corresponding screen resolution matches that of the local machine, for example, values assigned to the 'Scale100Percent' metrics object are not applicable when the local machine has a high-definition screen resolution.

The ResolutionIndependentMetrics class exposes the same properties as the resolution-specific metrics objects. Properties of this class, however, are scaled to approximate ideal values for each of the relative screen resolutions.

For example, assigning a value to the TileSizeSmall property changes the size at which both square and wide tiles are displayed. When the property is set on one of the resolution-specific metrics objects, the size of tiles for the other screen resolutions remains unaffected.

Setting the TileSizeSmall property on the ResolutionIndependentMetrics class, however, causes the tile size to change for all screen resolutions (assuming the property has not been set on the resolution-specific object).

The value of the ResolutionScale property determines the "baseline" resolution for the property values of this class. When scaling is applied to determine the size at which something should be displayed for a particular screen resolution, the value as defined on this class is scaled by a ratio that defines the difference in screen resolutions.

For example, if the ResolutionScale property is set to 'Scale100Percent', and the target screen resolution is 'Scale80Percent', the property value is scaled by a ratio of 4/5 (since the 'Scale80Percent' resolution setting implies a size of 80% that of the 'Scale100Percent' setting).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.ResolutionIndependentMetrics.ResolutionScale
member.remarks:
Returns or sets the relative screen resolution upon which all property values of this class are based.
Note: Changing the value of this property causes any previously assigned values for the other properties to be changed according to the difference in scale.
The ResolutionScale property defines the baseline resolutionscale, which is used to determine the scaling ratio when property values of this class are applied for a particular screen resolution.
For example, if the ResolutionScale property is set to 'Scale100Percent', and the target screen resolution is 'Low', property values are scaled by a ratio of 4/5 (since the Low resolution setting implies a size of 80% that of the 'Scale100Percent' setting).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.ResolutionIndependentMetrics.TileSizeSmall
member.summary: Returns or sets the size at which small tiles are displayed for this resolution scale, expressed in pixels.

remarks.p: The size of a tile whose CurrentSize property is set to 'Small' is determined by the value of this property.

To ensure that the edges of all tiles align evenly, all tile sizes are based on this value. 'Medium' tiles occupy the same amount of space as a 2 x 2 grid of four small tiles. 'Wide' tiles occupy the same amount of space as a 2 x 1 grid of medium tiles, and 'Large' tiles occupy the same amount of space as a 2 x 2 grid of medium tiles.
The value of the TileSpacing property also affects the size of medium, wide, and large tiles.
When not explicitly set, this property resolves to a value that is ideal for the local machine's current resolution scale.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.ResolutionIndependentMetrics.TileSizeMedium
member.summary: Returns the size of a medium tile at this resolution.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.ResolutionIndependentMetrics.TileSizeWide
member.summary: Returns the size of a wide tile at this resolution.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.ResolutionIndependentMetrics.TileSizeLarge
member.summary: Returns the size of a large square tile at this resolution.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.ResolutionIndependentMetrics.TileSpacing
member.summary: Returns or sets the amount of space between two adjacent tiles, expressed in pixels.

remarks.p: Note: Changing the value of this property changes the size at which wide tiles are displayed. The wide tile size is not a settable property because a wide tile must be exactly twice the width of a square tile, plus the value of the TileSpacing property, to ensure that two square tiles, side-by-side, are the same size as one wide tile.
Use the TileSizeWide property to obtain the actual dimensions of wide tiles.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.ResolutionIndependentMetrics.GroupSpacing
member.summary: Returns or sets the amount of horizontal space between two adjacent tile groups, expressed in pixels.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.MultiResolutionTileSizeSet
member.summary: Exposes a property for each of the for each of the four different screen resolutions at which a tile might be displayed.

remarks.p: One aspect of the Windows 8 user experience relates to screen resolution. Unlike platforms where the hardware and software are tightly coupled, Windows can be run on a variety of devices and configurations. This implies that different users of the same application can have widely disparate machine configurations.

Consider the case where the same application is run by one user on a desktop with a relatively low-resolution monitor, and another with a high-resolution tablet. A user interface element with a fixed pixel size will appear considerably smaller on the high-resolution monitor when compared to the same element on a low-resolution desktop. In the current technological environment, where touch-enabled devices are more prevalent, this can adversely affect an applications usability.
Live tiles are displayed at different sizes depending on the current resolution of the user's display adapter, as outlined in the following table:
The MultiResolutionTileSizeSet class provides a way for the developer to override the default tile size.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.StaticTile.DefaultView
member.summary: Returns the view which determines the content displayed for this tile when no view exists in the CultureSpecificViews collection for the current culture.

remarks.p: Use the DefaultView property to define a view for the tile that is not specific to a particular culture, or when application internationalization is not a concern.

The CultureSpecificViews collection can be used to define a view for a particular culture. When the local machine's current culture matches an item in the CultureSpecificViews collection, that view defines the content that is displayed for that user.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.StaticTile.CultureSpecificViews
member.summary: Returns a collection of StaticTileMediumContentBase derived objects, each of which represent the tile content for a specific culture.

remarks.p: The CultureSpecificViews collection stores static tile views that are targeted at a particular culture.
When the local machine's current culture matches an item in this collection, that item determines the view for the tile.

Use the DefaultView property to define a view that is not targeted at any particular culture. The default view is used when the CultureSpecificViews collection is empty, and also when the current culture does not match any of the items in the CultureSpecificViews collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinLiveTileView.CultureSpecificStaticTileView.CultureName
member.summary: Returns the name of the culture targeted by this instance.

remarks.p: The value of this property can represent either a neutral or specific culture. When the specified culture code references a neutral culture (for example, 'en', 'fr', or 'jp'), the associated view will be used for any specific culture whose Parent property references that neutral culture.

When the specified culture code references a specific culture (for example, 'en-US', 'fr-FR', or 'ja-JP'), the associated view will only be used when the name of the current culture matches the value of this property exactly.
For example, if the CultureName property is set to 'en', the associated view is used when the current culture is 'en-US', 'en-GB', 'en-CA', 'en-AU', etc.

However, if the CultureName property is set to a specific culture name such as 'en-US', 'en-GB', 'en-CA', 'en-AU', etc., the associated view is only used if the name of the current culture matches this property's value exactly.
